Articles.Content:
The challenge is fairly simple. Land on a mountainside (rough ground, either rocky and brown or covered in snow) with most or all of your aircraft intact.

Only C7 parts allowed - and no RCS thrusters!

Take three pictures: the approach, the plane at rest after landing, and the surroundings.

My attempt:

Winners shall be chosen based on whosoever has the most of their plane intact and the severity of the mountain they landed upon.

My mountain was rather easy and I still lost about half my plane, so it shouldn\'t be too hard to top me.

This seems fun. I\'m going to give it a go now.

A couple questions, though:

1. Are all C7 parts allowed, meaning both the C7 Flight Pack and C7 Aerospace Pack?

2. Any place I can find a topographic map of Kerbin so I can pick a landing point?
Here we go all 3 pics in attachments
Egads! I can\'t see! Can one of the rules be you have to land in daytime! ;D

Egads! I can\'t see! Can one of the rules be you have to land in daytime! ;D

is the brightness on your computer up?

This seems fun. I\'m going to give it a go now.

A couple questions, though:

1. Are all C7 parts allowed, meaning both the C7 Flight Pack and C7 Aerospace Pack?

2. Any place I can find a topographic map of Kerbin so I can pick a landing point?

Yes, both packs are allowed. Apologies for the lack of clarity.

I don\'t know about a topographical map, but mountains are clearly shown from the world map (m).
